Mat :)

No you can't get back associations from the SearchCRM.  You will have to call the associations api after you get the search results back.  I wrote a function that handles this anytime I need it which I now use all the time.  I send it the data from the search along with the fromObjectType and  toObjectType for the association I want and the function then gathers all the ID values from the data and calls the batch read for the associations.  Then it goes the extra and batch reads the actual object data and returns that data.  That was well worth the effort which was a lot but I use it all the time now.

Hello! We launched our HubSpot CMS site yesterday! Everything seems to be working great, but wanting to make sure we’re covered should catastrophe strike. How would we get a complete site backup so we can rollback if necessary? Maybe even download a zip file just in case. I see options to roll back to previous version of specific pages, but curious if there is a whole site backup/restore option I’m missing. Thanks in advance.

Congratulations on launch! :tada:

There's no backup/restore option for everything. While you can export pages and posts as "static HTML", you can't import those back for several reasons like security.


Something you could do is pulling everything via the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/cms/pages#retrieve-pages|Pages API>, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/cms/hubdb#tables|HubDB API> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/files/v3#files|File API>  and push it back into HS if needed.

And to adress the "catastrophe strike" - in all my years(7+) I'm working with HubSpot, I have never encountered such a blackout with any of the companies(can't count them anymore) I've worked for/with.

As of themes/modules and other code assets - you can store them in a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/setup/github-integration#set-up-continuous-integration-with-a-github-repository-using-github-actions|git repo>
How the heck can I make things responsive in the DnD editor :sob: Im #struggling
API keys are deprecated.  Instead, create a private app and use the key that will provide.  In your portal, go to Settings->Integrations->Private Apps to create one.

:wave: Hi everyone! Quick question that I can't find in the archives: what is the cheapest way to get access to the engagements API? I'm on the free plan now, and the next level up is "Starter Customer Platform" at $15/mo. Thanks!

How do you people deal with images in the CMS? Lets say we have a full widht image with fixed height or set a 1/1 aspect-ratio inside a module. Do clients need to deliver on point image sizing, or is there a way to crop and define image position???

I also have this problem -- our domain originally pointed to HubSpot directly and now is configured via reverse proxy.  We have a separate test domain configured from the outset via reverse proxy, and this one shows correctly as "Connected via reverse proxy".

<@U07B7AHM4EL> Did you ever get an answer on how to address this?  HS Support has not been helpful so far.

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hey <@U03ABR41A3H> - let's put it this way: Clients don't have to deliver on-point sized images but for performance and tech SEO reasons I would tell them to deliver something that is more or less in the required size. HubSpot will optimize the images to a certain amount but this is something that should be kept in mind.

Something I always tell my clients is:
• If an image should be in a two column layout the image should be provided in something like 600-800px width. 
• Hero images can be FullHD but can be resized to 1440px or 1680px. The upscaled version of those sizes are almost not recognizable to the human eye but it's better for performance
• Every images should be max. 200kb in file size

As for cropping you can resize/crop each image in the file manager but I'd recommend to do it with a tool like Photoshop before uploading
